item.title: Gabbard Says UK Scraps Demand for Apple to Give Backdoor Access to Data
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Britain abandoned its demand that Apple provide backdoor access to any encrypted user data stored in the cloud.

The post Gabbard Says UK Scraps Demand for Apple to Give Backdoor Access to Data appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Gambling Tech Firm Bragg Discloses Cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Bragg Gaming Group says hackers accessed its internal systems over the weekend, but did not affect its operations.

The post Gambling Tech Firm Bragg Discloses Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hacktivist Sentenced to 20 Months of Prison in UK
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Al-Tahery Al-Mashriky of the Yemen Cyber Army has been accused of hacking into and defacing many websites as part of hacktivist campaigns.

The post Hacktivist Sentenced to 20 Months of Prison in UK appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: New Exploit Poses Threat to SAP NetWeaver Instances
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
A new public exploit chains two critical flaws in SAP NetWeaver, exposing unpatched instances to code execution attacks.

The post New Exploit Poses Threat to SAP NetWeaver Instances appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 1.1 Million Unique Records Identified in Allianz Life Data Leak
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Have I Been Pwned has analyzed the information made public by the hackers who recently targeted Allianz Life.

The post 1.1 Million Unique Records Identified in Allianz Life Data Leak appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: New Research Links VPN Apps, Highlights Security Deficiencies
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Citizen Lab has identified links between multiple VPN providers, and multiple security weaknesses in their mobile applications.

The post New Research Links VPN Apps, Highlights Security Deficiencies appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hijacked Satellites and Orbiting Space Weapons: In the 21st Century, Space Is the New Battlefield
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
From hacked satellites to nuclear threats in orbit, the battle for dominance beyond Earth is redefining modern warfare and national security.

The post Hijacked Satellites and Orbiting Space Weapons: In the 21st Century, Space Is the New Battlefield appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Novel 5G Attack Bypasses Need for Malicious Base Station
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Researchers detailed a new 5G attack named Sni5Gect that can allow attackers to sniff traffic  and cause disruption.

The post Novel 5G Attack Bypasses Need for Malicious Base Station appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hundreds of N-able N-central Instances Affected by Exploited Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
More than 870 N-able N-central instances have not been patched against CVE-2025-8875 and CVE-2025-8876, two exploited vulnerabilities.

The post Hundreds of N-able N-central Instances Affected by Exploited Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Workday Data Breach Bears Signs of Widespread Salesforce Hack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Workday appears to have joined the list of major companies that had their Salesforce instances targeted by hackers. 

The post Workday Data Breach Bears Signs of Widespread Salesforce Hack appeared first on SecurityWeek.
